title: Protesters gather in front of Facebook HQ to decry its policy of allowing lies in political ads
text: The protesters said Facebook's policies make it possible for American voters to be manipulated through false information and targeted ads.

title: Barbara Corcoran: Facebook is the "last bastion of free speech"
text: Facebook is doubling down on their stance regarding political ads. Yahoo Finance’s Zack Guzman, Kristin Myers and The Corcoran Group Founder and Shark Tank star Barbara Corcoran discuss on YFi PM.

title: US should get rid of all political advertising, billionaire media mogul Barry Diller says
text: Billionaire media mogul Barry Diller told CNBC on Thursday that he believes the U.S. should not have paid political advertising.

title: Facebook tweaks ad policy but still allows political lies in U.S. campaign 2020
text: Facebook Inc announced limited changes on Thursday to its approach to political ads, including allowing users to turn off certain ad-targeting tools, but defied critics' demands that it bar politicians from using its ads system to spread lies.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg drops annual challenges to focus on longer-term goals
text: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Thursday he was dropping his annual challenges this year to take a longer-term focus on the decade ahead.

title: Mark Zuckerberg just made a bold claim: We're going to get a 'breakthrough' in tech glasses this decade
text: Facebook has been pushing to get into the business of virtual reality and augmented reality hardware since its 2014 acquisition of Oculus.

title: Facebook CEO Zuckerberg drops annual challenges to focus on longer-term goals
text: Facebook Inc's Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg said on Thursday he was dropping his annual challenges this year to take a longer term focus on the decade ahead.

title: Zuckerberg ditches annual challenges to improve 2030
text: Mark Zuckerberg won’t be spending 2020 focused on wearing ties, learning Mandarin, or just fixing Facebook.

title: 4 Mega-Tech Stocks Reaching for the Sky
text: The war trade is being quickly unwound with gold, crude oil, and energy stocks selling off while  technology stocks soar to the heavens.

title: 5 Hot Tech Stocks to Start 2020 Off Right
text: The outlook for markets in 2020 is murky, but these five tech stocks look likely to deliver

title: Facebook won’t ban political ads, prefers to keep screwing democracy
text: It’s 2020 — a key election year in the US — and Facebook is doubling down on its policy of letting people pay it to fuck around with democracy.

title: Facebook says it won't censor false political ads or limit targeting
text: Facebook announced it will not limit how political ads are targeted at specific users.

title: Facebook will continue to allow false claims in political ads
text: Facebook will continue to let political campaigns make false claims in advertisements despite pressure on the tech giant to clamp down on misinformation.

title: Facebook refuses to restrict untruthful political ads and micro-targeting
text: Facebook has decided not to limit how political ads can be targeted to specific groups of people, as its main digital-ad rival Google did in November to fight misinformation.

title: Facebook will let you see fewer political ads but won't stop micro-targeting
text: The social network has faced fierce criticism over its political ad policies.

title: Facebook says it will still let politicians lie in ads
text: Facebook said Thursday that it was "not deaf" to criticism of its policy allowing politicians to spread lies on its platform. But it will not change its rules.

title: Facebook and Instagram will allow users to “see fewer” political ads in time for the 2020 election
text: The political ads control will roll out in the U.S. “early this summer” before expanding to new locations.

title: Facebook says it will let people see fewer political ads ahead of US election
text: The news comes as Facebook faces intense political scrutiny and after Twitter implemented an outright ban on political advertising.

title: Facebook again declines to limit political ad targeting
text: Facebook has decided not to limit how political ads can be targeted to specific groups of people, as its main digital-ad rival Google did in November to fight misinformation.

title: Ahead of U.S. election, Facebook gives users some control over how they see political ads
text: Facebook Inc said on Thursday it was making some changes to its approach to political ads, including allowing users to turn off certain ad-targeting tools, but the updates stop far short of critics' demands and what rival companies have pledged to do.

title: Facebook Says It Won’t Back Down From Allowing Lies in Political Ads
text: The company was under intense pressure to adjust its policies. But in this presidential election year, no big changes are planned.
